subject: RE: [junit] Compatibility question for 4.5
msgSnippet: Nat, Yes, it is. That s the question: should we leave JUnit4TestRunner basically alone and change the name of the new one to BlockTestRunner (all the various
messageBody:
Nat,

Yes, it is. That's the question: should we leave JUnit4TestRunner basically
alone and change the name of the new one to BlockTestRunner (all the various
annotations and variations are implemented as "statements" which are
assembled into a "block" to run the test instead of the hideously nested
procedure calls we had before)?

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Nat
Pryce
Sent: Tuesday, June 10, 2008 11:36 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Compatibility question for 4.5



Is it possible for 4.5 to support both the old and the new runners for
one release?

--Nat

2008/6/10 Kent Beck <kentb@earthlink. <mailto:kentb%40earthlink.net> net>:
> All,
>
> We are nearing the release of JUnit 4.5. We have a question for all you
> custom runner writers out there. We have substantially restructured the
> internals of JUnit4TestRunner. Would you like the current version retained
> for at least one more release or shall we discard it?
>
> Regards,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>
>





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
